pageContext.claim: “True! [quoting a tweet that reads, 'We thought they spied on two Americans, we now know it was FOUR. The Inspector General’s report confirms what many of us feared: James Comey’s FBI ignored guidelines and rules in spying on President Trump’s campaign in 2016.']”
pageContext.analysis: The inspector general's report does not state that the FBI spied on Trump's campaign. A secret surveillance warrant was obtained on Trump foreign policy adviser Carter Page, who had left the campaign by the time the FISA application was approved. The warrant was renewed three times. The inspector general found numerous errors in the warrant application but no bias in the FBI's decision-making.
